data.title: "alternate" doesn't documented in "imagebuttons" or "textbuttons"
data.body:
The doc explains the "alternate" property only in the "button" section. Not in "imagebuttons" or "textbuttons"
http://renpy.org/doc/html/screens.html#button
http://renpy.org/doc/html/screens.html#imagebutton
http://renpy.org/doc/html/screens.html#textbutton

data.title: Ctrl-skip stops skipping after a few lines
data.body: No common factor found in the lines where skipping stops.

data.title: SnowBlossom fast=True <- new sprites appear mid-screen
data.body: With a SnowBlossom with fast set to True, replacement sprites appear in the middle of the screen as well as the initial ones.

data.title: Using more system resources in 6.99
data.body:
Another thing I noticed is that now the game seems to use much more system resources. I notice it immediately for example when I alt-tab and browse with Firefox. Clicking on each tab has 1 second delay, like if something else was using a lot of system resources, slowing down everything. As soon as I shut down the game, things are back normal.
I think happens mostly if there's a screen shown (screen language). If it's just normal dialogue the system load is more or less the same as before.

data.title: Latest build traceback with pop_return
data.body:
## Loading an old save with this latest version throws an exception (before was loading fine):

I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "game/plot/map.rpy", line 1503, in script call
    call expression par[0] from _call_expression
  File "game/plot/scene05_dingirra.rpy", line 596, in script call
    call gamesh_encounter from _call_gamesh_encounter_1
  File "game/plot/scene05_dingirra.rpy", line 464, in script
    pl "Gamesh mercenaries! They are coming toward us!"
Exception: Potential return stack corruption: dynamic=2 return=2

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "game/plot/map.rpy", line 1503, in script call
    call expression par[0] from _call_expression
  File "game/plot/scene05_dingirra.rpy", line 596, in script call
    call gamesh_encounter from _call_gamesh_encounter_1
  File "game/plot/scene05_dingirra.rpy", line 464, in script
    pl "Gamesh mercenaries! They are coming toward us!"
  File "C:- indie dev -\games\renpy\renpy\execution.py", line 300, in check_stacks
    raise e
Exception: Potential return stack corruption: dynamic=2 return=2

Windows-7-6.1.7601-SP1
Ren'Py 6.99.0.254
## Seasons Of The Wolf 1.0.7.5

It would be better if wasn't showing this error  :oops:  :oops: it happens with any savegame I load now! sometimes the value is like dynamic=1 return=1

data.title: Launcher still forces dedicated gpu.
Image Location Picker should copy coordinates to clipboard.
Nested dynamic imagemaps weird behaviour
data.body:
Dynamic nested imagemap uses parent imagemap images for hotspots, at least when first appearing.

Test case: http://my-files.ru/DownloadSave/e1ffka/imagemaps-nested-test.zip

Reproduction:
1. Launch game, click on "back" button, broken nested imagemap is displayed.
2. Click again, imagemap gets "repaired"

![imagemap-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1758893/6505752/5e68aa02-c356-11e4-8027-ddbada59625d.png)

data.title: Imagemaps break after updating hotspot coordinates
data.body:
Removing cache/ seems to help, so maybe at least perfom it on "Delete Persistent" or "Force Recompile" (in launcher) or just on every reload when config.developer is True? Obviously, proper fix should be better, though.

Here's test game to reproduce: http://my-files.ru/DownloadSave/hszgcm/imagemaps-test.zip

Reproduction:
1. launch -> back button is displayed & hovers ok
2. edit script.rpy: comment first hotspot line & uncomment second
3. reload game -> back button is displayed off & hover is weird
4. remove cache/ & reload -> works ok

![imagemap-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1758893/6487943/5bc00fb8-c2a5-11e4-88e4-7cde27f596f1.png)

data.title: Empty game causes infinite loop
data.body:
Well, this doesn't really matter, but this code makes renpy stuck in infinite loop :)

```
label main_menu:
    return

label start:
    return
```

Here's full game, just in case: http://my-files.ru/DownloadSave/cg7968/empty-game.zip

data.title: Building documentation doesn't mention pygame_sdl2
data.body:
Tried to build renpy using instructions in README, got the error about missing pygame_sdl2.h

```
gen/_renpy.c:252:37: fatal error: pygame_sdl2/pygame_sdl2.h: No such file or directory
#include "pygame_sdl2/pygame_sdl2.h"
```

Found https://github.com/renpy/pygame_sdl2, installed it into the same virtualenv as renpy, no effect. No includes were installed (perhaps that's pygame_sdl2 build script bug or i did something wrong..).

In the end manual adding required .h files from pygame_sdl2 src/ and gen/ worked, but that's not how building supposed to be.

Please update building instructions to include pygame_sdl2 related actions.

data.title: Update Spanish Translations

Joystick/Controller support needs to be tested in 6.99.
Contains statement doesn't restart when it's reshow.
data.body:
In 6.99.0.190, contains statement in ATL works only the first time when it's shown. After hiding it, reshowing the same image doesn't restart ATL block from the first line. Here's an example code:

```
image test:
    contains:
        "presplash.png"
        xalign .0
        linear 1.0 xalign 1.0

show test # The image moves form the left to the right
hide test
show test # The image is sticked to the right
```

data.title: PNG Screenshots are Broken
data.body: A screenshot taken from pressing 'S' key is a corrupt png file in windows7. It can't be opened in many applications. When I open it in photoshop, it's just a noisy pixel image.

data.title: A event isn't called when click a close button in v6.99.0.190
data.body:
I use a "show" event on a yesno_prompt screen like below,

```
screen yesno_prompt(message, yes_action, no_action):

    modal True
    on "show" action MouseMove(560, 170, 0.2)
```

But, a "show" event isn't called in v6.99.0.190 when click a close button on the window.
I use v6.99.0.190 and windows7

data.title: Alt+F quits renpy ignoring a prompt in v6.99.0.190
data.body:
In v6.99.0.190, Alt+F key quits a renpy game before replying to a yesno prompt.
I used windows 7

data.title: 6.99.0.183 console bug
data.body:
One big issue is Shift+O shows the console at the first time only. After hiding it, it never shows up. 
There's another minor issue. When the keymap "K_space" is mapped to some function, it can't be used in the console. For example, if K_space is mapped to "hide_window", pressing  the space key hides the console window instead of typing a space.

data.body:
Many power users have no need for the edit shortcuts in the launcher,
and in projects with a large number of script files hitting "edit all
script files" by accident can be annoying
